content: Because once you – assuming wages don't continue to climb at a rate that we've never seen, but if there is a bit of a one-time reset and then gradual wage inflation after that, our same store sales growth that we've had historically pre-COVID 53 straight quarters are positive same store sales that averaged across those quarters 12% most of that being member growth and as we've talked about, there's not really any cost that gets added if your store increases its membership from 6,500 to 7,500 members.
